intro: Hiraea ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous hiraea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems. Hiraea ambigua is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
